definitions.text: that which is responsible for one's thoughts and feelings; the seat of the faculty of reason
examples: I couldn't get his words out of my head

definitions.text: an opinion formed by judging something
examples: he was reluctant to make his judgment known
the great minds of the 17th century

definitions.text: your intention; what you intend to do
examples: he had in mind to see his old teacher
the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces
he reads to improve his mind

definitions.text: be offended or bothered by; take offense with, be bothered by
be concerned with or about something or somebody
be in charge of or deal with
examples: She takes care of all the necessary arrangements

definitions.text: pay close attention to; give heed to
examples: Heed the advice of the old men

definitions.text: be on one's guard; be cautious or wary about; be alert to
